March 18, 196k
Chatto and Windus Publishers
1jO-42 William IV Street
London W.C. 2, England
ACTS Rights and Remissions
Dear Sir*
We are requesting overseas authorization from the Chatto and Hindus Publishers
to use a poem by Richard Eberhart, f*For A lmb,1 tor which we understand you
hold the copyright. Wfe have already contacted the Oxford University Press in
Hew York for permission, which we received, but they informed us we must also
obtain overseas permission from you.
Permission to use this material is being sought by the H.A.E.B. in connection
with an arrangement we have with the Voice of America to develop an English
Through Poetry series. She 13 commentaries for those programs are being
written by Professor M. L. Rosenthal of New York university. The Voice of
America, in turn, working closely with Professor Rosenthal, will produce 13
quarter-hour radio scripts on the basis of these commentaries. The radio
programs themselves are intended for broadcast to listeners overseas, and
are being designed to appeal to the listeners interest in poetry in the English
language.
In each script the poem will be read in its entirety, and the listeners will
also be invited to read the lines aloud in appropriate units after the radio
speaker.
Permission is sought both dSBr the broadcast by the Voice of America to
overseas countries and for broadcast in countries where local radio stations
may receive the taped programs through the United States Information Agency.
Permission is also sought for publication of the poems that might be published
in any given country (with, the aid or supervision of U.S.I.A.), and distributed
free or at cost to radio listeners. Permission is also sought for eventual
publication of the materials in a similar study booklet to be produced by
U.S.IAA. for gratis distribution to overseas listeners who request such booklets.
Wfe hope we will hear from you shortly and that authorization to use this poem
in the manner which we have wutlined will be forthcoming. If you would like
to have additional information, may I suggest you contact Dr. Robert Gooden,
Chief, Radio EngXish-Teaching Branch, Voice of America, Washington, D.C.
Sincerely,
James A. Fellows
Assistant Director
